result.execSummary:
The defendant Benedict G. Weiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benedict G. Weiler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court Trial 1/24/17 requsted by attorney Wedemeyer for son's case 16CF128.

Defendant, Benedict G. Weiler appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Rachel Hoeppner  duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft in the courtroom.  Deputy Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies. Id'd deft in the courtroom.  Recall of Rachel Hoeppner (still under oath)  State rests at 9:22 am.  Deft Benedict G Weiler  duly sworn and testifies.  Court advises the deft as to his rights to testify in court.  Recall Rachel Hoeppner at 9:30 am after the deft testimony.  State has no further evidence at 9:32 am  
Closing statements made by the parties.
Court takes a recess to review his notes back on the record at  10:10 am Back on the record at 10:29 am.
Court grants the State's request to amend the criminal complaint.  
Court makes findings a fact and rules Court finds the deft guilty of the charge.

Court orders:
$100 fine + costs  60 dtp

Defendant, Benedict G. Weiler appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court addresses the deft. Court reviews the waiver of attorney form given to the court by the deft.  Court advises the deft as to his rights of an attorney.  FVI  Court advises the deft of his rights to a jury trial.  Deft gives up the right FVI  Court will along this to proceed to a trial to the court.
Status conference on January 18, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Defendant, Benedict G. Weiler appeared by phone.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given at 11:19 am.  Deft not able to appear in person due to vehicle problem.  Will need to reschedule the Status conference.  Court advises the deft as to how to apply for a Court appointed attorney.  Court agrees to reschedule.  Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Court trial on January 24, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Report to the LIncoln County Jail for booking if not already completed.
Status conference on September 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Report to the LIncoln County Jail for booking if not already completed.

Defendant, Benedict G. Weiler appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
